title: River Of Regrets
opening: The Sacred Stones that defeated The Demon King radiated a constant and dazzling light. The Sacred Stones are the only power against the dark, the last hope of humanity. It is only natural that evil would seek to destroy the Sacred Stones... There can be no other force behind this attempt to gain the stones. A childhood friend appears before Ephraim.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: How do you intend to use the Sacred Stones, Lyon? Do you really think you can tap into its power?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Mm... My research isn't complete yet, but there's no mistaking the power the Sacred Stones contain. And the Stone of Grado seems especially responsive to my dark magic. I suppose it's because it contains both sacred and demonic properties. Regardless, if I can just press my studies a little harder... Well, I think I might be able to use it to heal my father's illness. If that works there's no telling how many other people I can help as well.

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: Do you think this is wise? The power contained within the stones is beyond our understanding... My father tells me that the stones posses a power not to be trifled with.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Uh-huh... Father MacGregor is also against it. That's why they still won't give me direct access to the Stone of Grado. For the time being, I've made do with the radiant energies surrounding it. They're nothing compared to the raw power of the stone itself, but... If I can show Father MacGregor some real progress, perhaps one day...

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: Using the Sacred Stones to study magic...

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Ephraim, Eirika, what do you two think? Using the divine power of the Sacred Stones in this way... You don't think it's a very good idea, do you?

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: ...It's just that I know nothing at all about magic. I would that there were some way I could help you, but I simply can't. But, Lyon, I've seen how hard you've worked to help others. I know how much you want the power to make others happy. I know these things, and because I know you, I trust your intentions.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Ephraim...

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: If you hope to use the power of the Sacred Stones for good, I trust you can. I'm behind you all the way.

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: I'agree with Ephraim entirely. You spend every night in the library, studying cures for your father's illness. The power of the Sacred Stones is too powerful to be used for personal gain. But you, Lyon... I think you'll be fine. You're the kindest person I know.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Thanks, both of you. Hearing those words means a lot to me. Actually—and this hasn't been made public yet—but... I've already saved someone using the knowledge I've gleaned so far.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: You have?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Uh-huh... A while back, a fire ravaged Serafew, and a little girl got trapped in the flames. Her burns were terrible: not even healing staves were able to cure her injuries. But just a sliver of the stone's power restored her life and healed her wounds. We saved the that girl's life, Ephraim! Oh, if you could have seen the tears of joy in her mother's eyes!

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: You really did it, huh? You are special, Lyon. Congratulations!

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Well.. thanks. But there's still so much more to be done. I am happy, though. To be honest, I just want to be able to help people. I want to put the ancient magics to use for common good... That's how I feel.

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: Lyon...

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: And as my research moves forward, I'll be able to do much more, too. We have only the barest understanding of how dark magic operates. Maybe we can use it not only to heal wounds, but also to stop diseases... What if we can read the future, predict disasters, move mountains!?

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: Hold on, Lyon. You can't take too much on yourself all at once. What good is helping people, if you sacrifice yourself to do it?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Oh... Yes, of course. Sorry. I got carried away.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: You have a soft heart, Lyon. I bet you haven't taken any real time off at all. So this is what we're going to do. Today, we're going into the city. And you're coming with us, Lyon.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: What? But, Ephraim, you've got a history report due.

flashback.speaker: Ephraim
flashback.line: We're taking today off. C'mon, let's go.

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Bu-but, Ephraim...

flashback.speaker: Eirika
flashback.line: It's just one day, and I won't tell anyone. Won't it be fun for the three of us to spend a day in the city?

flashback.speaker: Lyon
flashback.line: Ephraim, Eirika... Thanks so much. I'm lucky to have the two of you as friend.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: We have the Stone of Renais. The final Sacred Stone is in Rausten

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: L'Arachel, can you tell us anything about the Stone of Rausten?

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Naturally! As Rausten's very own princess, I know a thing or two about our stone. The palace reliquary currently houses of Sacred Stone. Follow me, I'll take you there

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: I sent the Frelian army ahead before us. They should be en route to Rausten. If we hurry, we can join up with them at the banks of the Narube River.

intro.speaker: Ally Soldier
intro.line: Do not falter! Show them the might of Frelia!

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Lady S-Syrene... the enemy is headed this way.

intro.speaker: Syrene
intro.line: Are you serious? Grado's been defeated, and still they fought on? And they're tough.

intro.speaker: Old Man
intro.line: You Frelian fools have been wiped out by those guys... Oh, no... Now we're finished as well.

intro.speaker: Syrene
intro.line: Everyone, please remain calm. If you panic and flee, the enemy will simply surround you. If you remain here and don't move I promise to protect you all.

intro.speaker: Woman
intro.line: Lady Syrene...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Brother! Look there!

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: A skirmish!

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Is that Syrene? What's going on? We must go to her aid.

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: Everyone, hold! Something evil is afoot...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Eirika... Ephraim...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon... Where have you been all this...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Eirika, stop!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Brother?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon... We met recently in Grado Keep, right? Do you remember what you told me then?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: ...... Of course, I remember. What of it?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: You...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I can repeat it for you now if you would like. The ruin of Renais? The murder of your father? It was all my doing. I, Lyon, prince of Grado, made it happen.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon... You lie! That can't be...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Don't be fooled, Eirika. Keep your guard up. That's now Lyon.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: ...... What amusing things come babbling out of your mouth. You always thought of Lyon as kind, gentle, and weak, didn't you? Admit it.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: No! Lyon, Eirika, and I were friends. There were things we kept to ourselves of course, but we shared so much. And no matter what happened, no matter how much time passed... We're still friends. Lyon would never betray us. Not in a million years. You're not Lyon.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: ...I see. So I have no reason to continue hiding my true identity, do I?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: None!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: You are correct. This body no longer belongs to your young Lyon. I devoured his pathetic heart ages ago.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: You monster! Who are you?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Do you really not know me? What a poorly educated prince. Think about it. Remember the legends of your pitiful kind... What was sealed within the Stone of Grado? What is the name of terror?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No... It can't be!

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: It's as we feared after all. That can only be...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: The great adversary of antiquity... The Demon King...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: That's right. You know to fear my name. Prince Lyon was a weakling. Now, he is dead.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: That can't be...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Prince Ephraim of Renais... You hold a Sacred Stone. Give it to me. I have no wish to see a warrior die a pitiful death beneath my feet. Bend your knee. If you pledge services to me, I may yet let you live.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Do you take me for a fool?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: You've made your choice, have you? A poor choice... But it does afford me a chance to show you something special. A force no human flesh can withstand. A horror beyond words. A power that will place this sad world under my dominion. I am the Demon King... Behold my might.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Lyon... We met recently in Grado Keep, right? Do you remember what you told me then? You told me that this was all your doing, that you had started this war.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: What? Ephraim... Why are you so angry? We haven't seen each-other in so long... What's happened?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Wait, Eirika! You said it yourself. Lyon must be under the control of someone or something else.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Don't be ridiculous! There must be something wrong with you, Ephraim! Lyon is one of our dearest and closest friends, remember? He told me that, no matter what happened, he was still on our side. Isn't that right, Lyon?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Yes, Eirika. Of course it is. So, please, come here... Closer... Ah! Gah.. ahh... Uuuuhhaaah... ga...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Gah.... rrrrraaa... Ev... ahh... evil...  Stay... back... Eirika...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Get away... from me... quickly... If you... don't... I will surely... ...destroy you...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What? Lyon...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Flee... qui-quickly... GO! Gah...... Aaaaaaarrrrggggghhh!

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Ly-Lyon. Hold on! What is it? What's happening?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Hi. It's been a while since I saw you two last, hasn't it?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Lyon? Is that really you speaking, Lyon?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Stay back, Eirika. Keep your guard up. That's not Lyon.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: Uh...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I'm not Lyon? That's rich. A masterpiece. You always thought Lyon was kind, gentle, and weak, didn't you? Admit it.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: No! Lyon, Eirika, and I were friends. There were things we kept to ourselves, of course, but we shared so much. And no matter what happened, no matter how much time passed... We're still friends. Lyon would never betray us. Not in a million years. You're not Lyon.

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: ...Hmph. ...Looks like I was wrong to disregard the value of human emotions.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I've had my fun pretending to be human, but the need for charades has passed. You are correct. This body no longer belongs to your young Lyon. I devoured his pathetic heart ages ago.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: You monster! Who are you?!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Do you really not know me? What a poorly educated prince. Think about it. Remember the legends of your pitiful kind... What was sealed within the Stone of Grado? What is the name of terror?

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No... It can't be!

intro.speaker: L'Arachel
intro.line: It's as we feared after all. That can only be...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: The great adversary of antiquity... The Demon King...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Heh heh... ha hahahahah! Lyon... Lyon... O prince of misery... Come out. Be not shy... This body is lost to you... It is mine to compel...

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: What's going...

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Your dreams, Lyon... I am about to make them come true for you. I am about to crush Prince Ephraim and take Princess Eirika for my own. Isn't this all that you've ever prayed for, young fool of a prince?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Ah!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: Rejoice, Lyon. The time has come... Ephraim, the man you envy... Eirika, the woman you desire... I will now grant you all of your darkest wishes!

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Prince Innes...is it... Ah... It really is you, isn't it, Prince Innes? Being rescued by you... It's like a dream...

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: Syrene? I need a status report.

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Oh... Oh, yes! Please forgive me! The Frelian troops we dispatched were ambushed and decimated. My squad is all that remains.

recruit-talk.speaker: Innes
recruit-talk.line: So many dead... You can rest easy now, Syrene. I'm here. Victory is assured. Let's go.

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Princess Tana! You must stay back. This place is dangerous!

recruit-talk.speaker: Tana
recruit-talk.line: No! I won't let you die! Hold on, I'm coming to help you at once!

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Princess Tana... You've grown so much. Very well. I'm yours to command, my lady.

recruit-talk.speaker: Vanessa
recruit-talk.line: Commander Syrene! Are you all right?

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Vanessa. What are you doing here...

recruit-talk.speaker: Vanessa
recruit-talk.line: I'm here with Prince Innes! We arrived to join the fray! We'll take over now. There's no need for you to exhaust yourself.

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: Understood. The chain of command must be clear, though, so I'll take orders from your commander. Pass this message to whoever leads your forces, will you?

recruit-talk.speaker: Syrene
recruit-talk.line: You've matured since I last saw you last. And... you've grown beautiful as well.

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: Do you challenge me? You humans are so inconstant. You've forgotten what it is to fear me.

boss.speaker: Ephraim
boss.line: Where's Lyon? What have you done with our friend?! ANSWER ME!

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: ...... Heh heh... How foolish. The one you seek is already dead. I have cast him into the abyss from which I crawled. The weakling is gone. Only the Demon King remains!

boss.speaker: Eirika
boss.line: Please, Lyon! You must stop! I...I don't want to fight you!

boss.speaker: Lyon
boss.line: ...... The cries of children. Away with you, insects, if you wish not to die.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Not yet... I have not the strength. But I am the Demon King... The world will be mine, as it was in the ancient days. Injuries such as those are not enough to stop me...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Demon King!

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Come, Ephraim. You should follow me. If you've the strength to defeat me, that is...

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We will not let you flee! After him, Eirika! We have to find where he's gone. Search everywhere! I can't allow him to desecrate my friend's body any longer!

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Ephraim.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Innes?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: There's no need to panic. The soldiers are following Prince Lyon's trail. Our trackers are excellent. They'll know his whereabouts momentarily.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Ah... Good point. Well made.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: By the way, there's something I need to speak with you about. The messenger I sent to Frelia returned not long ago. She bought a package I'd request: Frelia's Sacred Twins.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You have the Sacred Twins?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Yes. Frelia may have lost her Sacred Stone... However, it seems the Sacred Twin relics remain undisturbed. I have bought them here. Behold!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Incredible...

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Frelia's Sacred Twins. Nidhogg, the Serpent Bow, and Vidofnir, the Winged Lance. I want you to take them.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: But these are Frelia's weapons. You should hold on to them.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: No, I entrust them to you. You're the leader of this army. Use them as you will.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Understood. I'll make sure they wind up in worthy hands. Thank you, Innes. This helps.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: Don't thank me. We're fighting for the same thing here: victory.

end.speaker: Woman
end.line: Lady Syrene! Thank you! We all owe you our gratitude...

end.speaker: Syrene
end.line: No, it wasn't my doing. We prevailed because of superior leadership.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: No, I...

end.speaker: Old Man
end.line: We owe you a debt of gratitude that can never be repaid. It's not much. but please accept this staff as a small token.

end.speaker: Woman
end.line: And accept our thanks. We won't forget what you've done for us.

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Urr... Bah... Can't hold up to such as this? Accursed human flesh is too brittle, too weak...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Hold, Lyon!

end.speaker: Lyon
end.line: Now, I know your strength. It is time to leave. I sacrifice this flesh and return to my body of old. This does not end. The world will drown again in darkness.
